brewery.brewery_description: We are a family friendly brewery and tap room in the heart of the Ballard Brewing District. Also! Science!! We are owned and operated by a Chemist, a Biologist and an aesthetically motivated marketer. As scientists, our fundamental understanding of fermentation results in consistent quality. Guided by our aesthetic sensibilities, we hope to have created a uniquely appealing tap room for our beer-loving patrons.

items.checkin_comment: FH25#10: Fresh Strata from Coleman Agriculture in Oregon’s Willamette Valley. Passion fruit, bitter & crisp.

beer.beer_name: Fresh Hop Fiend IPA – Strata (2025 – Coleman Agriculture)
beer.beer_description:
Strata Fresh Hop Fiend 2025

The 2nd in our 2025 Fresh Hop Fiend series, Strata Fresh Hop Fiend is packed with 300 lbs. per batch of Strata fresh hops from our friends at Coleman Agriculture in the Willamette Valley of Oregon. Strata brings aromas of Melon and passion fruit. Drink it fast and fresh!

items.badge_description: We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 15 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 4! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_name: Fresh Hop Fiend IPA – Simcoe (2025 – Sauve & Son Farms)

items.checkin_comment: Wow!  Best fresh hop I’ve had at Stoup this year. So fresh, bright, tropical! Yummy!

user.bio:
Jesuit priest who loves to travel and explore local breweries. 

On the lookout for the best WC IPA!

beer.beer_name: Fresh Hop Fiend IPA – Amarillo & Strata (2025 – Roy Farms)

items.badge_description: Celebrating Pride doesn't stop when June ends. Thanks for supporting the Queer community 365 days out of the year by checking in a beer from one of these Queer-owned and Queer-led breweries! Now keep going. Try 5 more for Level 10.

beer.beer_description:
ABV: 6.2%: IBU: 45 SRM: 31 
Rich in color and character, our robust porter conjures up memories of decadent chocolate treats dipped in coffee. Hints of dark chocolate, roasted coffee and light malty sweetness are the result of a complex malt profile including chocolate malt, roasted wheat and roasted rye

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 51)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 52!
Dating back to the 18th century, porters remain an extremely popular style to this day. That is 15 different beers with the style of Porter. Try 5 more Level 4!

beer.beer_description: Our take on this traditional style is a pale lager brewed with German pilsner malt and Czech Kazbek hops. It has a medium body, a touch of pilsner malt sweetness and a balanced noble hop bitterness and aroma.

items.badge_description: Celebrating Pride doesn't stop when June ends. Thanks for supporting the Queer community 365 days out of the year by checking in a beer from one of these Queer-owned and Queer-led breweries! Now keep going. Try 5 more for Level 3.

At a new place and don't want to choose a pint of something you may not like? Grab a few tasters! Enjoy some small pours and then decide which to upgrade to a full pour. That's 85 checkins with the serving style of Taster. Try 5 more for Level 18! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 95 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 20!
After a long day, what better way to kick back than with a crisp and refreshing lager? You're already feeling more relaxed, aren’t you?. That’s 40 different Lagers! Try 5 more for Level 9!

beer.beer_description: This clean, crisp German style beer has a delicate malt sweetness from German 2-row Pilsner malt as well as subtle German hop character from Tettnanger hops. Refreshing with a dry finish. A perfect spring crusher.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 170 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 35!

You’ve pledged allegiance, and now it’s time to enjoy some beer! Now remember, not all American beer is fizzy and yellow. That’s 275 different beers from a brewery in the United States. Try 5 more for Level 56!

beer.beer_description:
ABV: 5.2% IBU: 37 SRM: 3 
Imported German 2-row barley and Roy Farms ADHA 1940 hops give this German-style pils it's crisp, clean character.  Warning: this beer's subtle grain sweetness, spicy hop aroma and refreshingly dry, hop-forward finish may elicit a spontaneous Prost!

ABV: 6.2%: IBU: 45 SRM: 31 
Rich in color and character, our robust porter conjures up memories of decadent chocolate treats dipped in coffee. Hints of dark chocolate, roasted coffee and light malty sweetness are the result of a complex malt profile including chocolate malt, roasted wheat and roasted rye

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 395 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 80! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: For the first brew at our beautiful, new Capitol Hill brewery, we decided to give the Cap Hill people what they wanted. HAZY! We added Cryo POP! to the whirlpool for a burst of tropical aroma and flavors then gave even more tropical, melon and berry aromas with HBC 1019 and Mosaic Cryo in the dry hop. Cheers to many more beers brewed at Stoup Capitol Hill!

items.badge_description:
Start the season off right with your friends from Punch Cigars! Get to know the Official Cigar of Beer Lovers a little better here: www.punchcigars.com.
For sale in the U.S. only.
Enjoying a nice Night Out on the town? Thanks for taking Untappd along.

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 3)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 4!
It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 10 check-ins with a photo.

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 5 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 2!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 10 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 3! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description:
ABV 5.9%: IBU: 50 SRM: 3 
We like to call this one Sunshine In a Glass ... or Sunshine In Your Belly because it won't stay in that glass long. Our Citra® IPA is designed to be light and bright in both color and body. Your first sniff will elicit images of tropical fruit and citrus thanks to a healthy dose of Citra® hops. Enjoy a pint of this and you might just find yourself gazing skyward, pondering how in the heck sunshine made its way into your glass.

items.badge_description:
Start the season off right with your friends from Punch Cigars! Get to know the Official Cigar of Beer Lovers a little better here: www.punchcigars.com.
For sale in the U.S. only.

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 105 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 22!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 75 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 16!

What's better than enjoying a beer outside with food, music, games all in an enjoyable atmosphere? We couldn't think of anything. That's a beer at 5 different venues with the category of Beer Garden. Visit 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description: Rich, malty layers of toffee, caramel and...ahem...booze will likely make you want to take a seat, relax and forget about work for a while. We endorse that decision.

user.bio: Member of the zombie version of the Bellingham Beer Zoo.

beer.beer_description: Tropical, citrus

items.checkin_comment: Really interesting. Guava pineapple with some pine resin.

beer.beer_name: Fresh Hop Fiend IPA – Simcoe (2025 – Sauve & Son Farms)

beer.beer_description: Born and bred in Ballard the USA, this IPA rocks the old school and new school hops. Chinook and Centennial hops from Roy Farms bring the pine, grapefruit and lemon while Vic Secret hops pack a pineapple, passion fruit punch. To keep this party rockin' 8 days a week, we kept the malt bill soft and gentle on the palate. Like a lemon to a lime, a lime to a lemon, you'll sip this def ale with all the fine women...and men....or whoever you want to sip it with.

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 26)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 27!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 80 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 17! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: We brewed this hazy gem for our friends at the Space Needle and Chihuly Garden and Glass. Can you think of a more beautiful place to drink a beer?! And if you're going to brew a beer for two of the coolest places in the world, you've got to add some of the greatest hops ever grown, Citra, Simcoe and Mosaic. This IPA has got citrus, berry and pine galore. Perfect for drinking perched high above our beautiful city.

items.badge_description:
Start the season off right with your friends from Punch Cigars! Get to know the Official Cigar of Beer Lovers a little better here: www.punchcigars.com.
For sale in the U.S. only.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 20 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 5!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 15 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 4! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description:
ABV 5.9%: IBU: 50 SRM: 3 
We like to call this one Sunshine In a Glass ... or Sunshine In Your Belly because it won't stay in that glass long. Our Citra® IPA is designed to be light and bright in both color and body. Your first sniff will elicit images of tropical fruit and citrus thanks to a healthy dose of Citra® hops. Enjoy a pint of this and you might just find yourself gazing skyward, pondering how in the heck sunshine made its way into your glass.

ABV: 5.3% IBU: 39 SRM: 5 
A highly drinkable, hop forward beer with a classic American Pale Ale malt bill. Heavy handed Mosaic dry hopping gives this beer a nose packed full of citrus and mango. Up front aroma, balanced bittering and a moderate body just beg for another taste...and another...and another...

ABV: 5.0% IBU: 40 SRM:12 
Our Northwest Red Ale provides a distinctly Northwest hop character balanced with a restrained malt sweetness. We use 2 Row barley along with Best Maltz Red X to create a rich, red color and a smooth, satisfying taste. A hint of chocolate seals the deal.

ABV: 6.2%: IBU: 45 SRM: 31 
Rich in color and character, our robust porter conjures up memories of decadent chocolate treats dipped in coffee. Hints of dark chocolate, roasted coffee and light malty sweetness are the result of a complex malt profile including chocolate malt, roasted wheat and roasted rye

Close your eyes, take a sip of this beer and you're sure to be transported to a tree-lined, sun-speckled biergarten in Munich. We honor tradition by brewing this beer using decoction mashing techniques and fermenting with a German yeast strain that imparts prominent banana and clove notes. The wheat gives this beer a crisp, slightly tart, refreshing finish.

ABV: 5.2% IBU: 37 SRM: 3 
Imported German 2-row barley and Roy Farms ADHA 1940 hops give this German-style pils it's crisp, clean character.  Warning: this beer's subtle grain sweetness, spicy hop aroma and refreshingly dry, hop-forward finish may elicit a spontaneous Prost!

We love Mosaic Hops, you love Mosaic Hops, so why not try them three ways.... We used Resonate, Pellets and Cryo pellets in this homage to the mighty Mosaic.  While not a single hop beer this beer screams Mosaic (mango and citrus aroma and flavor) from start to finish.

Call us old-fashioned or retro or...old, but sometimes we long for the days of yesteryear. The days when Seattle was rainy and grungy and kind of greasy. When you didn't have to iron your flannel shirts and Birkenstocks were a fashion statement (only if they were really smelly and worn within a millimeter of the asphalt). In an effort to celebrate those angst filled days, we brewed this hazy IPA (like the skies back then, get it?). Unfortunately, due to our naturally sunny dispositions and close proximity to so many hopeful millenials, we couldn't help but pack it with the brightest, citrusiest, peachiest, passionfruitiest hops we could find-Citra, Mosaic and Galaxy. So, celebrate those glory days with Sandals &
Bittered with Columbus, dry hopped with new  Vic Secret hops from Australia

We brewed this hazy gem for our friends at the Space Needle and Chihuly Garden and Glass. Can you think of a more beautiful place to drink a beer?! And if you're going to brew a beer for two of the coolest places in the world, you've got to add some of the greatest hops ever grown, Citra, Simcoe and Mosaic. This IPA has got citrus, berry and pine galore. Perfect for drinking perched high above our beautiful city.

Released with the name "Please & Thank You IPA", this 6% (Alcohol By Volume) beer is a bit more modest in bitterness at 57 IBU. Made with Rakau, Citra Cryo and Loral Cryo hops, Please & Thank You is described by the brewers as a beer with notes of berry, citrus, and pine while illuminating your glass with a beautiful golden color. Look for this uniquely-named India Pale Ale on tap at Stoup Brewing Company's Ballard taproom this week.
Chinook fresh hop IPA created with Latona Pub and Chuck’s Hop Shop.

Double IPA equals double hop pleasure! This beer is bittered with Chinook with copious amounts of Simcoe added in the whirlpool and dry hop. Hop additions in the forms of Pellets, cryo-pellets and resinate result in loads of layered goodness

Our Mexican Lager is perfect for sunny days on the patio or the beach...preferably in flip flops. Since we can't guarantee sunny days in Seattle, we kept this lager light and bright and irresistably crushable, sunshine not required. Salud!

In the entire history of humankind, there has never been a more profound expression of love than the  personalized mixtape. Hours of deliberation about which songs to share from your home tape collection followed by hours of tiny handwritten playlists with tiny hearts incorporated wherever possible. Follow that with "play"-"record", change tape, "play"-"record" change tape............This beer is our mixtape for you. First we brewed the beer with pilsner malt for a light body and gentle malt sweetness. Then we lagered the beer for several weeks to create a clean, refreshing crispness. As our mixtape final song, we dry hopped with  Bru-1 and Nelson Sauvin for aromas of white grape and stone fruit. Load it up, press play and enjoy.

Our second IPA in the Stoup Pride month series is simply joy in a glass. Feast your eyes on a giddy dance of bubbles in every color of the rainbow while enjoying the aromas of Hallertau Blanc and HBC 630. So as not to overpower the delicate aromas of gooseberry, white grape and tropical fruit, we kept the malt bill soft with additions of wheat and pilsner malt. It's moderately dry and extremely crushable. We raise a glass of Rainbow Bubbles IPA to equality, compassion, and the incredible gift of loving people for who they are. (Disclaimer: the bubbles are NOT rainbow colored. That's impossible, silly).

Hoping to hit on a hop profile that would shoot this beer to Seattle stardom and eternal cameo appearances on local fundraising television specials, we brought a posse of Sabro,Vic Secret, Mosaic Cryo and Simcoe hops for a tropical and earthy dankness (with a little pine and citrus, also). This is Seattle after all. Gotta keep it dank as hell, but, you know, approachable.

Born and bred in Ballard the USA, this IPA rocks the old school and new school hops. Chinook and Centennial hops from Roy Farms bring the pine, grapefruit and lemon while Vic Secret hops pack a pineapple, passion fruit punch. To keep this party rockin' 8 days a week, we kept the malt bill soft and gentle on the palate. Like a lemon to a lime, a lime to a lemon, you'll sip this def ale with all the fine women...and men....or whoever you want to sip it with.

Let's make plans to hang with friends, take vacations, see a show, sit at a bar and...well... look forward to the good times to come, but in the meantime, feel free to slow your roll, relax your mind and enjoy this tropical fruit, citrus and mango-full IPA. Galaxy, Citra Cryo, Mosaic Cryo and Wakatu hops at your service

If you're looking for a lesson in the deliciousness of Simcoe hops, drink this beer! We added loads of Simcoe Cryo hops in the whirlpool and in the dry hop. We threw a little Citra in there to keep it honest, but if you're searching for the citrus and pine that only Simcoe can deliver, this beer is for you!

Aromas and flavors of dark roasted malts, molasses and a hint of chocolate. Moderately dry and with just enough alcohol warmth to let you know it’s there, our export stout will make you want to wrap your fingers around a pint, cozy up to the bar and enjoy some quality time together. (A portion of proceeds support Reverend Harth & his mustache rangers as they raise money for men’s health during the month of MOvember.)

In good times and in bad times, if we just remember to love each other, everything will be okay. And what better way to celebrate our shared human experience than to enjoy a beer brewed just for you from your friends at Stoup (who love you very much)? Try this smooth, moderately bittered IPA dry hopped with Belma, Strata, Galaxy and a touch of Sabro. It's strawberry, passion fruit and citrus, all wrapped in a hug of a beer.

Old pathways lost under a blanket of freshly fallen snow make way for new tracks on trails yet to be made. Powder Tracks Winter Ale, a malt forward beer with chocolate and caramel notes touched with a  hint of citrus aroma, will call you to forget the noise and embrace the quiet of a winter trail.

Seattle's Pride parade may have been cancelled this year, but our LGBTQIA+ friends and allies are coming together anyway to celebrate a vibrant, beautiful community. We brewed this beer to help fuel the passion for equality and acceptance and also to just have some fun together. Think of this beer as fuel for a parade that we missed, but look forward to next year! Hops: Enigma, Chinook and Comet.

We didn't even study for this one, Galaxy and Simcoe hops make this one an Easy A. The aroma and flavor is chock-full of Guava, citrus & a bit of pine. The fruit carries to the finish begging another taste.
